「Thus, *The Paramitas of the Mysterious Concord*[《参同契》] states:
*The lone *yang* sprout*
*cannot stand alone.*
*Water unites *yin* and *yang*—*
*only then does it become the Great Medicine.*

*This reveals the hidden workings of Heaven,*
*which cannot be heard through ordinary means,*
*a profound admonition.*

*The commentary explains:*
*Water itself is not divine,*
*but when it aligns with the cosmic cycles,*
*it becomes true.*
*Hence, it is called *Divine Water*[神水].
*This water is none other than*
*the five phases[五行] harmonizing,*
*the four seasons[四象] cycling,*
*the eternal return of the Daoist furnace[陶家之输返],*
*revolving through countless extremes,*
*when its transformations are complete,*
*all things have their appointed form.*

*Moreover, the True Person[真人]*
*creates and refines at the outset with purpose,*
*and at the end with resolution.*
*Before signs manifest,*
*all things reveal themselves—*
*what difficulty could there be?*

*Like the sun and moon returning in their cycles,*
*day and night perpetually alternating.*
*Thus the world is formed,*
*and its transformations extend infinitely to all beings.*
*This is the beginning of understanding*
*the measures of *yin* and *yang*,*
*their revolving cycles,*
*endless yet unexhausted.*

*If one speaks of refining the Great Elixir[大丹],*
*it must be done in resonance with the seasons,*
*for its methods differ from worldly practices,*
*and no two ages share the same laws.*
*Divine Water is not inherently divine,*
*but its marvels arise from the cosmic numbers.*

*Furthermore, *The Book of Yin Symbols*[《阴符》] states:*
*The arts of the Great Elixir number a hundred,*
*but their essence lies in*
*Divine Water and the Azure Pool[华池].*
*Thus it is known that*
*the Great Elixir, once obtained,*
*transforms endlessly,*
*constantly ascending,*
*eternally harmonizing with Heaven and Earth.*

*The commentary explains:*
*Water’s nature is*
*fully *yang* in form,*
*yet capable of *yin*.*
*Place a hundred *hu*[斛] in a cauldron,*
*boil and dry it,*
*and its formlessness is revealed.*
*Yet it nourishes the vast Earth,*
*and all things grow from it.*
*Why then does it have form?*

*This form*
*steals the vital *qi* of Heaven and Earth,*
*and arises from it.*
*The classic states:*
*"All things in Heaven and Earth*
*that steal the One*
*are born by embracing *yin* and bearing *yang*."*
*Thus, both Heaven’s transformations and all things’ appointed forms*
*are fully explained,*
*and the Great Elixir is perfected.*

*The commentary explains:*
*When the Great Elixir’s transformations are complete,*
*where does the Divine Water return?*
*The commentary explains:*
*Divine Water is the Mother,*
*True Lead[真铅] unites with it to form the embryo.*
*Within the Golden Furnace[金鼎],*
*it steals the numbers of the five phases,*
*aligning with the daily celestial rotations,*
*the stars and constellations in their proper order,*
*the talismans and seals urging its progress,*
*its water becomes divine,*
*its *qi* descends as true,*
*Black Lead emits its essence,*
*Golden Flowers surge forth—*
*yet none of it leaks,*
*all coalescing into the Elixir.*
*This is the perfected work of the Sage,*
*the Great Elixir taking form as substance.*

*This substance is not the same as Earth’s soil,*
*yet shares its *qi*—*
*the Sage still relies on the *Yijing*[易]*
*to clarify the symbols.*

*Wang Bi’s commentary states:*
*"Abiding in the center to attain correctness,*
*reaching the limit of Earth’s soil,*
*letting nature take its course,*
*and things spontaneously arise,*
*without artificial cultivation,*
*yet the work is accomplished—*
*thus, one does not practice it,*
*and yet nothing is left unfulfilled."*

*The commentary explains:*
*Why does it not require practice yet bring benefit?*
*Is this not a paradox?*
*But by reversing the *yang* cycles*
*and restoring the *yin* position,*
*it requires no practice.*
*Revolving through the paths,*
*returning to its origin,*
*it first reveals itself in its essence—*
*what need is there to worry about its end?*
*Thus, it requires no practice.*

*This teaching further explains*
*Heaven’s eternal principles,*
*the sun and moon’s revolving cycles,*
*and the interplay of *yang* and *yin*—*
*their waxing and waning according to time,*
*the origins of symbols and numbers,*
*stolen and applied,*
*transmitted among the worthy,*
*rarely encountered by the world.*

*Hence the classic states:*
*"The myriad forms cannot evade their numbers,*
*how much less so humans,*
*how much less so ghosts and spirits?"*
*Those who cannot align with*
*these cosmic laws and cycles*
*are merely the vulgar tastes of mortals.*
*The Dao of the Sage and the Wise is not so.*

*《The Book of Yin Symbols》 states:*
*"Heaven’s nature is human,*
*humanity’s essence is the hidden mechanism."*
*Establishing Heaven’s Dao*
*to settle humanity’s mind.*
*Thus, one alters Heaven’s heart,*
*locks the transformations of the cosmos,*
*reverses the five phases,*
*cycles the eight trigrams,*
*fixes the celestial nodes,*
*and divides day and night.*
*This is Heaven’s hidden mechanism,*
*humanity’s theft of it.*
*Obtaining it, the universe is within one’s grasp,*
*and all things are within one’s body,*
*for the mechanism of Heaven is now manifest in humanity.*

*Once the profound symbols are clear,*
*the Great Elixir is complete.*

*The commentary explains:*
*The Primordial *Yang* Child[元阳子] states,*
*"*Yang* Heaven is the Father,*
*Earth *yin* is the Mother,*
*The Vermilion Bird[朱雀] of the South,*
*The Dark Warrior[玄武] of the North.*
*At the year’s end and the season’s close,*
*both become soil.*
*Where does the common man seek*
*Dragon and Tiger?"*

*Soil is the symbol of form,*
*its virtue residing in the Yellow Position[黄位].*
*The Yellow Position signifies*
*the completion of the ninety-nine cycles,*
*transformations fully realized,*
*earning the name of soil,*
*the initial stage of the Elixir.*

*It is said that soil can overcome water,*
*a great principle for*
*consuming and refining the cauldron’s water,*
*the Sage’s intent made clear—*
*water returns to soil.*
*Thus, it is not the soil of Earth,*
*but the initial form of the Elixir,*
*earning the name of the White Tiger,*
*capable of swallowing the Green Dragon.*

*The Elixir scriptures state:*
*"Dragon and Tiger*
*alternately swallow and are swallowed,*
*establishing the fixed position within.*
*Through the eight celestial nodes,*
*the cold and warm shift,*
*gradually transforming into the root of the yellow sprout."*

*Thus it is known that*
*the yellow sprout belongs to soil,*
*which can consume water.*

*The commentary explains:*
*Water has no stagnant form,*
*it contains *qi* and blends with the true.*
*Once the essence is refined,*
*the Golden Elixir congeals.*

*The Elixir scriptures state:*
*"The Golden Elixir is the Great Elixir—*
*this is it.*
*The world’s people fail to comprehend,*
*losing their homes and livelihoods,*
*unable to measure its depths."*

*The commentary explains:*
*The so-called Great Elixir*
*is not a mineral of gold or stone,*
*but borrows its name from the Western direction,*
*its origin being the pure white.*
*《The Paramitas of the Mysterious Concord》 states:*
*"Cinnabar[丹砂] is originally pure,*
*not inherently red,*
*yet its seasons sort it in the Southern Dwelling."*

*The Southern Dwelling is the Green,*
*the pulse that receives *yin* and the female,*
*the descent of the *yin* principle.*
*When the pulses gather,*
*it turns red,*
*the *yin* *qi* glowing crimson,*
*its blood flowing with certainty.*

*Xu Jun states:*
*"Male *qi* is white and emits essence,*
*female *qi* is red and emits blood."*
*The *yang* Dao is male,*
*the *yin* Dao is female.*
*Gathering *qi* forms the embryo,*
*receiving *yin* establishes the master.*
*Only when the Elixir receives *yin*
*does its color change—*
*it was never red from the start.*
*Hence the classic states:*
*"Cinnabar is originally pure,*
*not inherently red."*

*The Autumn Stone[秋石]*
*is also the White Stone mentioned earlier.*
*Its symbol is in the West,*
*thus it is called Autumn Stone.*

*The commentary explains:*
*In opening the Great Elixir,*
*one takes the symbol of Metal’s vigor,*
*White Dew being the first,*
*its strength peaking at the *You* Earth[酉地].*
*This is when*
*Metal and Water’s *qi* are clear and settled,*
*the Metal Autumn month is full and flourishing,*
*the Golden Flowers abundant and overflowing—*
*the proper time for refining the Elixir.*」

chunks.original_text: 魏真人曰：采有日，取有时，世人用之而不知。 况乎古仙炼药，但取金气圆明，蟾光满盛，真人共用，万一皆同无二也。 又曰：金丹得水互兆滋，隆起自虚无，从无生有。 凡运金丹，须明真一。 真一者，水也。 育丹为母，真者气也，气为道化。 化者是行气之义，直侯气足，方名为道。 行气者，二气是也。 况乎非远，目前可见矣。 包真人云：真一法朝，日在眼前。 太上曰：大道泛兮，其可左右。 万物恃之而生，生而不辞，又何远乎。 又经曰：母藏子胞，子隐母胎，知白守黑，神明自来。 白者，西方金也，金者便是母也。 黑者，北方水也，水者便是子也。 知有西方金也。 丹首起北方壬癸，壬癸是水也。 经云：金胤於水但安水，叉存其丹，斯言黑白二义明矣。 故丹书云：知白守黑，求死不得，此之谓也。 青霞君云：水为凝而纳火，金消散而入水，水火之气相蒸，金形相转，往而不定，上下无常。 水得火而升，金得水而潜，相须变化，凝结气中，又何朱砂潜火，水银结霜。 丹书云：画镜照胆，登山网鱼，何日获之。 夫炼丹炼神水，有水始生牙，火釜烧金药，金药是三花。 金虎元君云：炼三花但去其玄色，色归西方之色正白。 经云：洁白见宝，可造金花矣。 此花入鼎，须凭刻漏，始分清浊。 如无漏刻，灵芽不生，三花入鼎。 歌曰：入鼎须凭漏，无漏不成丹。 如盲奔却杖，聋者抱琴弹。 大丹无漏，如盲者奔杖，无以能进。 虽加喊水火，奈时候不正，默而·不分，又何定气升降，如聋者弹琴，自不能分别也。 论曰：漏者便是此日直符，使者符到奉行，算阴阳水火正数，一进一退，定其斤两，合日辰，应运金·鼎，先定天地时而后行事，顺天地也。 《阴符经》曰：阴阳相推，而变化顺矣。 论曰：且如此日阳时将至，漏已来报，即称太阳应数，累功成乾。 其或阴时将至，漏已来报，即称太阴应数，累功成坤。 如是乾坤俱备，阴阳两全，夺天地造化之功，盗四时生成之务，鼎中灵药，万一成真，红液流珠，天人共爱。 论曰：已前分漏，时在运火，牙必成矣。 时在运丹，丹必成矣。 并同兹法天象成形。 又《紫阳金碧经》云：还丹之道，与九鼎法同，神水化功，更相运入斯。 乃前九鼎炼牙，后九鼎炼丹，故日还丹之道，与九鼎法同。 《周易参同》曰：漏刻未过半，鱼鳞狎猎起。 如是明分刻，漏显配五行。 昼夜玄功，应运符节。 经云：符节者，是分管此日十二时之候也。 昼夜应运，曾无暂停，至道神功，准漏消息，阴阳变化，恍惚而迁，水被火逼，时不相容。 故元君曰：恍惚变化，在於当时。 《参同》曰：隆冬大暑，盛夏霜雪，二分纵横，不依漏刻。 此是《参同》圣意，微密之妙旨也。 诀曰：若运丹升降之次，辄勿暂抛药炉，听察吟声，调燮火候，进火稍麓，前功恐失。 失者，是火数与时不相应也。 春木未满，夏火已行，夏暑炎炎，却行冬令，此是掌炉之人懈怠之过也。 是何灰暗日久，火养岁年，颗块朱砂，犹言未伏。 论曰：且如金液之丹，是金华之气凝结而成，人得服之，流胤百脉，驻颜返老，行疾如风，万灾莫及，龙神仰敬，土地护持，服之岁月，别有异常之事。 服药三年，别有真圣灵异之事。 更资阴隐，直候上升。

Wei Zhenren said:
*"The timing of gathering is fixed,
the season of taking is precise—
yet the world uses it without knowing.*

*How much more so the ancient immortals refining elixirs,
who merely await the Metal *qi*’s round brilliance,
the toad’s light at its fullest—
all true persons share this,
and even a tenth of it is unmatched.*

*Again it is said:*
*The Elixir obtains Water’s mutual nourishment,
rising from emptiness to fullness,
from non-being to being.*

*In refining the Elixir,
one must grasp the True Unity.*
*The True Unity is Water.*
*Water nurtures the Elixir as a mother;
True refers to *qi*—
*qi* is the transformation of the Dao.*
*Transformation means the movement of *qi*;
only when *qi* is sufficient does it become the Dao.*
*The movement of *qi* is the interplay of the two *qi*’s.*
*How much closer it is—
visible before one’s eyes.*

*Bao Zhenren said:*
*The True Unity method is ever-present,
the sun before one’s gaze.*

*The Most High said:*
*The Great Dao is vast—
how could it be confined to left or right?*
*All things rely on it to live,
living without complaint—
how could it be distant?*

*The classic further states:*
*The mother contains the child’s womb,
the child hides within the mother’s body.
Knowing White while guarding Black,
divine clarity comes naturally.*
*White is the West’s Metal—
Metal is the mother.*
*Black is the North’s Water—
Water is the child.*
*Knowing the West’s Metal,*
*the Elixir first arises from the North’s *Ren* and *Gui* (Water’s stems),*
*for *Ren* and *Gui* are Water.*
*The classic says:*
*‘Metal depends on Water—
only by settling Water
does one preserve the Elixir.’*
*Thus the dual meaning of Black and White is clear.*

*Hence the Elixir scripture states:*
*‘Know White, guard Black—
seek death and you shall not find it.’*

*Qingxia Jun said:*
*Water condenses to receive Fire,
Metal disperses and enters Water.
When Water and Fire *qi* intermingle,
Metal’s form transforms—
unsettled, without fixed direction,
neither high nor low remains constant.*
*Water obtains Fire and ascends,
Metal obtains Water and descends;
mutually dependent in transformation,
congealing within *qi*—
how could it be like cinnabar hiding Fire,
mercury forming frost?*

*The Elixir scripture says:*
*‘Mirror-drawing to catch the gall,
mountain-climbing to net fish—
when shall this be achieved?’*

*Refining the Elixir and the Spirit Water,
only with Water does the tooth form;
the Fire cauldron sears the Golden Medicine—
the Golden Medicine is the Three Flowers.*

*Jin Hu Yuanjun said:*
*Refining the Three Flowers merely removes their primordial hue,
restoring them to the West’s true color—pure white.*
*The classic says:*
*‘When pure white appears, the Golden Flower may be forged.’*
*This Flower, once placed in the crucible,
must rely on the water clock’s division
before purity and turbidity are separated.*
*Without the water clock,
no divine sprout will grow;
the Three Flowers enter the crucible.*
*The verse says:*
*‘Entry depends on the clock’s measure—
without it, the Elixir fails.’*
*Like the blind rushing without a staff,
the deaf strumming a zither—
the Great Elixir without the clock
is like the blind stumbling without guidance,
unable to proceed.*
*Though one shouts for Water and Fire,
the moment is ill-timed—
silent and unseparated,
how could the *qi*’s ascent and descent be fixed?
Like the deaf playing the zither,
they cannot distinguish at all.*

*The commentary says:*
*The clock is the day’s direct talisman;
when the messenger’s talisman arrives,
calculate the true numbers of yin and yang,
Water and Fire’s advance and retreat,
determine their weight,
align with the hour and stem-branch,
respond to the crucible’s *qi*—
first fix the timing of Heaven and Earth,
then act in accordance.*

*The *Yinfu Classic* says:*
*‘Yin and yang push each other,
and transformation proceeds in harmony.’*

*The commentary says:*
*If the solar hour is near and the clock reports it,
declare ‘The Great Sun’s number is fulfilled,
accumulating merit to complete *Qian*.’*
*If the lunar hour is near and the clock reports it,
declare ‘The Great Yin’s number is fulfilled,
accumulating merit to complete *Kun*.’*
*Thus when *Qian* and *Kun* are both complete,
yin and yang fully harmonized,
you seize Heaven and Earth’s creative power,
plunder the four seasons’ generative duties—
the crucible’s divine medicine,
once perfected, yields crimson nectar,
loved by both Heaven and humanity.*

*The commentary says:*
*Before the clock’s division,
if the time is for refining the tooth,
the tooth will surely form.*
*If the time is for refining the Elixir,
the Elixir will surely form.*
*All follow this method to manifest the Heavenly symbol.*

*The *Ziyang Jinbi Classic* says:*
*The Dao of Returning the Elixir
is the same as the Nine Crucible method;
Spirit Water’s function
is further refined through mutual circulation.*
*First, the Nine Crucibles refine the tooth,
then the Nine Crucibles refine the Elixir—
hence it is said the Dao of Returning the Elixir
is the same as the Nine Crucible method.*

*The *Zhouyi Parameters* say:*
*Before the water clock’s half-mark passes,
scaly fish dart and scatter.*
*Thus, when the clock’s division is clear,
its markings align with the Five Phases.*
*Day and night’s mysterious operations
respond to the talisman’s nodes.*
*The classic says:*
*The nodes are the divisions of the twelve daily hours.*
*Day and night proceed without pause,
the supreme Dao’s divine function
adjusts to the clock’s ebb and flow.*
*Yin and yang transform—
fleeting yet shifting.*
*Water pressed by Fire
cannot endure the moment’s constraint.*

*Hence Yuanjun says:*
*‘Fleeting transformation
lies in that very instant.’*

*The *Parameters* say:*
*‘In deep winter’s scorching heat,
summer’s frost and snow,
the solstices’ horizontal sweep
defies the clock’s measure.’*
*This is the *Parameters*’ sacred intent,
its profound and subtle meaning.*

*The secret says:*
*When refining the Elixir’s ascent and descent,
never abandon the furnace for an instant.
Listen for the *qi*’s murmurs,
adjust the Fire’s temper—
gradually increase the heat;
otherwise, prior efforts may be lost.*
*Loss comes when Fire’s measure fails to align with the time.*
*Spring Wood not yet full,
Summer Fire already active—
Summer’s blazing heat
yet enforcing Winter’s order—
this is the fault of the furnace-tender’s negligence.*
*Why then does the ash darken over years,
Fire nurtured for seasons,
while cinnabar’s grains
still claim not to be subdued?*

*The commentary says:*
*As for the Golden Liquid Elixir,
it is the condensed *qi* of the Golden Flower’s essence.
When a person ingests it,
it flows through the hundred channels,
preserving youth and reversing aging,
moving swiftly as wind,
immune to all calamities—
dragons and spirits revere it,
Earth and spirits protect it.
Those who take it for years
experience extraordinary events.*
*After three years of ingestion,
truly divine and miraculous events occur.*
*Further relying on yin’s concealment,
awaiting its supreme ascent."*

chunks.original_text: 此是九转金液，凝结化为还丹。 岂是朱砂作粉，水银为霜，恨之甚矣。 是谓学不稽古，暗详经论，以意自裁，背道返德，万家倾产，一无可成，实为世愚，孰能开悟。 而况前贤后圣，大丹理贯一源，故无二三，尽明真一，妙算五行，钻簇阴阳，潜运寒暑，仁贤相授，广业经纶，知铅汞之根源，定水火之大数，如斯明白，始可经营矣。 诀曰：且如脉同一身，漏行百刻，时随漏应，准刻定时，漏既不得，丹随时变。 此一法众仙共禁之诀，荃蹄之义，息忘经纶，途远妙极之理，神明丹中要义，无过此诀矣。 《太易》曰：一日有十二时，阳六时，阴六时，便是时计之数也。 转运轮还，时内消息，又如何顽心度日，弊意弥年，一向灰暗，将延岁月，故堪取笑，实谓痛哉。 可惜光阴散亡，学仙之士，请细详焉。 且如定气分节，大凡五日一候，计六十时，禽类胎卵，应节变迁。 书云：后五日，雀入水化为蛤。 后五日，野鹦入水化为蜃。 后五日，鹰化为鸠。 后五日，田鼠化为驾。 制不自由，时至化也。 理丹玄象，运化亦同。 后五日，神水冰丹形变，斯乃天时共造，律历同迁神化也。 诸圣玄意，丹家多议，此一科也。 又圣意一科，且如今日直符，开启运丹，复卦为首，起火子位，发爻通灵，而终於已，纯阳也。 妮者，纳音之首，收摄元气，而终於亥，纯阴也。 此日行火大数，理乾坤二卦，变一十二爻，计一十二时，时数之内，有阴有阳，有明有暗，有动有静，有进有退，升降随时，周而一匝，鼎中灵药，随卦变通，五色流光，天人共贺。 此诀外镌金简，内宝存心，凡传於人，贤圣相授，斋修重誓，莫妄轻泄。 乃元始玄言，毕法金科，勿违师诚。 茅君诚文曰：天门开，地户闭，圣人机密，勿妄漏泄。 妄泄真诀，殃及绝灭。 岂非容易哉。 又云：得者不泄，泄者丧德。 付之以言，诫守玄默。 论曰：若得药源，万一成矣。 必利众生，且非一人。 此药得成，有全家拔宅之功，非独一人升举也。 且见今人炼药，虽有其言，而无其实。 朝朝说道，日日言丹，究论真诠，罔知圣意。 如斯暗昧，自尚未能，孰为利众，而全家升举者哉。 经云：若昧药源，一身难存。 若明神水，全家归真。 神水圣石，一龙一虎，二物知宗，神仙之倡，此之谓也。 论曰：得者日学日新， 但得药源，经营有神，一月一合，开鼎沐浴，观其颜色，渐睹幽深，鼎鼎见信，转为玄功，其道日新，可见重矣。 迷者日学日昏。 迷者错认朱砂水银，便为大药，千烧万缎，如末如灰，罔合经纶，无由取信。 既差玄旨，转益昏迷，皓首如丝，何以开悟。 其道转加，日昏迷之甚矣。 推道守一， 推道纪钢，妙在守一。

This is the Ninefold Transformation of Golden Liquid,
condensed and refined into Returning Elixir.
How could it be mere cinnabar turned to powder,
mercury as frost?
This regret is profound indeed.

This is called studying without examining antiquity,
obscurely expounding scriptures and commentaries,
cutting according to one’s own whims,
abandoning the Dao and inverting virtue.
Families squander their wealth,
yet achieve nothing—
truly the fools of the world,
who can awaken them?

Yet the sages of old and the saints of later times,
their profound elixir principles flow from a single source,
so there is no second or third.
They fully illuminate the True Unity,
master the marvelous calculations of the Five Phases,
delve into the interplay of yin and yang,
govern the circulation of cold and heat,
passing down knowledge from benevolent and virtuous ones.
They broaden their practices and refine their wisdom,
knowing the roots of lead and mercury,
fixing the great numbers of water and fire—
so clear and evident,
only then can one undertake their work.

The secret formula says:
*Just as the pulse is one within the body,
yet the hundred pores leak in a thousand moments,
time follows the pores’ flow,
and the moments measure time.
If the pores cannot be controlled,
the elixir changes with each moment.*

This is a universal formula forbidden by all immortals,
a profound meaning of the *Qiánshān* [1] tradition.
To forget the scriptures and commentaries,
to stray far from the subtle and extreme principles—
this is the essence of the elixir’s divine truth,
none surpass this formula.

*The Great Ease* [2] says:
*A day has twelve times—
six of yang, six of yin—
this is the reckoning of time.*

The revolving cycles return,
concealment and manifestation occur within time.
How could a dull heart measure days,
or a flawed intention span years,
ever lingering in darkness,
wasting time in vain?
This is truly lamentable—
a pity to squander light and time.
Aspiring immortals,
please examine this carefully.

Just as the *qi* is divided by nodes,
the general rule is five days for one phase,
counting sixty times [3].
Birds and beasts, their eggs and births,
change according to the nodes.
The text says:
*After five days, a sparrow entering water becomes a clam.*
*After five days, a wild parrot entering water becomes a jellyfish.*
*After five days, an eagle transforms into a dove.*
*After five days, a field mouse becomes a tortoise.*
Transformation is not free to command—
when the time arrives, change occurs.
The principles of elixir and profound symbols
are the same in their transformations.
*After five days, the Divine Water’s form alters like ice and elixir—*
this is the heavens’ shared work,
the laws of time and transformation aligning with divine change.

The profound intentions of the saints,
the elixir schools’ many debates—
this is one such principle.

Another principle of the saints:
*As today’s direct correspondence,
unlocking the elixir’s transformation,
the Hexagram of Reunion is paramount,
igniting the Fire Branch,
awakening the trigrams to divine resonance,
yet ending at the Geng [4] stem—
pure yang.*

*Nǐ* [5] is the first of the received sounds,
gathering and containing the primordial *qi*,
yet ending at the Hài [6] stem—
pure yin.

Today’s Fire Branch governs the numbers,
harmonizing the Hexagrams of Heaven and Earth,
shifting twelve lines [7],
counting twelve times.
Within these times,
there is yin and yang,
light and dark,
movement and stillness,
advance and retreat—
ascend and descend with each moment,
cycling in full return.
The alchemical cauldron’s sacred medicine
adapts to the hexagram’s changes,
five colors radiant in flowing light—
heaven and humans rejoice together.

This formula is engraved on golden tablets externally,
yet treasured within the heart internally.
When passed to others,
saints and virtuous ones transmit it solemnly,
with fasting, purification, and solemn oaths,
never to be casually revealed.

It is the Primordial Beginning’s mysterious speech,
the ultimate golden principle—
do not betray the teacher’s sincerity.

The Lord of the Tea [8] earnestly wrote:
*The Celestial Gate opens,
the Earthly Portal closes—
the saint’s secrets must not be divulged.*
*To recklessly reveal the true formula,*
*disaster will follow, leading to extinction.*
*Is this not easy to understand?*

It is also said:
*Those who receive it do not disclose it,
those who disclose it lose their virtue.*
*Pass it on with words,*
*yet warn to guard the profound silence.*

The commentary says:
*If one obtains the medicine’s source,*
*success is certain.*
*It must benefit all beings,*
*not just one.*

When this medicine is perfected,
it grants the power to elevate an entire household,
not just one person.
Yet see today’s practitioners refining elixirs—
though they speak of it,
they lack the true substance.
Daily they speak of the Dao,
daily they discuss the elixir,
yet when examining the genuine meaning,
they know not the saints’ intentions.
So obscured, they cannot even achieve their own goals—
who then can benefit all and elevate a household?

The scripture says:
*If one remains ignorant of the medicine’s source,*
*even one’s own life cannot be preserved.*
*If one understands the Divine Water,*
*the whole family returns to the True.*

The Divine Water and sacred stone—
one dragon, one tiger,
two substances knowing their essence—
the foundation of immortality,
this is what is meant.

The commentary says:
*Those who receive it grow wiser each day,
yet only upon obtaining the medicine’s source
can cultivation be truly inspired.
Once a month, the elixir coalesces,
the cauldron is opened for bathing,
observing its hues,
gradually perceiving the depths.
Each cauldron’s transformation confirms its truth,
becoming profound function—
its Dao renews daily,
its importance is evident.*

*Those who are lost grow more confused each day.*
*Lost ones mistake cinnabar and mercury*
*for the great medicine,*
*boiling and refining them endlessly,*
*turning them to dust or ash,*
*never aligning with the principles,*
*with no way to confirm its truth.*
*Having strayed from the profound intent,*
*their confusion only deepens,*
*their heads white as thread—*
*how can they awaken?*
*Their Dao grows ever more distorted,*
*their confusion ever more profound.*

*Follow the Dao and uphold the One,*
*Follow the Dao and remember lead,*
*The marvel lies in upholding the One.*

chunks.original_text: 起甲钻算，春令发扬。 经云：三五之道，天地常用，以时消息，巡历后土，归於中官，其数见五。 三五与一，天地至精，可付口诀，难以书传。 大丹之要，非数莫能知其神。 神水华池，非真铅不能合其道。 若明守一，已知大道纲纪，无不尽者也。 皇天无亲。 上天普育万物，爱人最深，玄象天机，与人相合，道成德就，玉皇可见，惟道可亲，昭于上帝也。 我命在我， 非天制我有其生，非天纵我亡其寿。 三才永固，各保元精，惟人摄养多乖，不悟营修大药，上天明鉴，法象昭然，大道经管，丹书遍载，自无志学，负己辜身，弃命如泥，却为鬼物。 且积修而难得者，莫贵於我身。 因循而易失者，不闻於仙道也。 况且真铅不远，百姓日用而不知。 大药非遥，满市黄芽而莫测。 几夫不学上士难传，而况常人有言，大命由乎天也。 如斯不悟，何以闻之。 若言命既由天，子之服毒，何政死乎。 历观今古得道者，千万余人，始自常夫从学，安得玉皇垂诏，白日冲天。 故知求生者，叉遂其生，昧死者，任从其死。 升沈得失，未可言天，我命在我者也。 非丹不存。 尘病下士，恣欲饮酒，腥膻血肉，沈滞五脏六腑，秽气蒸熏，身重百斤，何以轻举。 若非金丹妙药，无以涤荡，神药一化，返老为童，位列真人，名标玉籍，与天地齐休，若非金丹，不可存也。 炼之可久， 运造神室之丹，且非一朝一夕之功。 几九转成牙，九转成丹，开启造化，须处名山，同道数人，晨昏资备，药室坛炉，穿砌井宠，二时朝拜，斋粥资修，志念归真，神明如一，实非容易，岁久方成，故日炼之可久也。 饵之长新， 服药之后，三尸之虫渐去，还精补髓都全，暗室有光，童颜日盛，精神爽异，道气吉祥，五岳灵真，自然而会，神魂彻视，玉髓全身，趣戏仙都，故曰长新也。 数通即化， 圣人炼化灵药，大数运通四时，春季发而万物生，夏季旺而火炎盛，秋季收而金实，冬季伏而水凝，丹家制造，但得通此四时行气，金丹自然变化，故日数通则化也。 数极乃神， 言数之极满也。 但论阴阳数满，药方乃神。 阴极则阳潜，阳极则阴屈，二气互用，道之自然。 又言极者，是穷变之道尽矣。 乃得阴阳之道，极数者也。 是神仙之妙，变化之法，故日数极乃神。 获斯天机， 天下能事者，不过得道。 得道简易，莫出於丹。 治丹之妙，擒制於气。 化气有形，不过於数。 数造金丹，三五与一，获此天机，神仙事毕也。 永列真人。 世有数千玄卫，继约万端，若言永列真人。 一粒还丹，升举霄汉。 金丹真一论竟

The skin is pierced for calculation,
spring commands its flourishing.

The scriptures say:
The Dao of *three-five* is ever-present in heaven and earth,
used to measure time and regulate the flow of *qi* through the land,
returning to the *Zhongguan* [central official],
its numbers manifest in five.
*Three-five* and *One* are the utmost essence of heaven and earth,
which may be entrusted to oral precepts,
yet is difficult to record in writing.

The essence of the Great Elixir lies beyond mere numbers,
without which its spirit cannot be known.
Divine *qi* and the Alchemical Pool cannot be united
without the true lead.

If one understands and upholds the *One*,
already knowing the fundamental principles of the Great Dao,
nothing remains unfulfilled.

The Celestial Sovereign has no favorites.
The Highest Heaven nurtures all things universally,
its love for humanity most profound,
its mysterious symbols and heavenly mechanisms
in harmony with humanity—
when the Dao is realized, virtue attained,
the Jade Emperor becomes manifest,
yet only the Dao can be truly cherished,
as revealed to the Supreme Deity.

My life is in my own hands,
not decreed by Heaven to live or die.
It does not grant my birth nor decree my death.
The Three Realms endure eternally,
each preserving its original essence,
yet only humanity often fails to cultivate itself,
unaware of refining the Great Elixir.
The Highest Heaven’s clear discernment,
the radiant patterns of the law,
the Great Dao’s precepts and sacred writings
are everywhere—
yet those without aspiration to learn
betray themselves,
forfeit their lives like mud,
and become mere specters.

Moreover, what is difficult to accumulate through cultivation
is no greater than my own body.
What is easily lost through negligence
is not heard of in the Dao of Immortals.
Yet true lead is not distant—
common folk use it daily without knowing.
The Great Elixir is not far—
yellow sprouts fill the markets yet none perceive it.
Even the *jifu* [lowly scholar] struggle to learn,
while the *shangshi* [exalted sage] cannot easily transmit.
How much more so for ordinary people who say,
"Great fate lies with Heaven!"

If one does not awaken to this,
how can they ever hear the truth?
If one claims fate is by Heaven’s decree,
then why does a child’s ingestion of poison
not inevitably lead to death?
Examining past and present who attained the Dao—
thousands, even millions—
they began as common folk in study,
how could the Jade Emperor descend with edicts,
or the sun ascend to the heavens in broad daylight?
Thus, those who seek life
find their life fulfilled,
those who remain ignorant of death
suffer it as their due.
Ascension and decline, gain and loss,
cannot be spoken of as Heaven’s doing—
for my life is in my own hands.

Without the Elixir, life cannot persist.
The *chénbìng* [dust-illness] afflicts the lowly,
who indulge in meat and alcohol,
greasy and blood-rich, clogging the five *zàng* [viscera] and six *fǔ* [bowels].
Filth and *qi* seethe,
weighting the body like a hundred pounds—
how could it rise lightly?
If not for the Golden Elixir’s marvelous medicine,
there is no way to purify and transform.
With one dose of divine medicine,
aging reverses to youth,
ranking among the True Persons,
name inscribed in the Jade Register,
sharing eternal life with Heaven and Earth—
without the Golden Elixir,
life cannot be preserved.

Cultivation requires enduring time,
refining the Elixir in the sacred chamber of *qi*.
It is not the work of a single morning or evening.
Nine transformations yield *yá* [alchemical tooth],
nine more yield the Elixir,
unlocking the principles of creation,
requiring secluded peaks,
a few like-minded companions,
morning and evening devotion,
the Alchemical Hall and furnace,
well-laid bricks and tiles,
twice-daily reverence,
fasting gruel for sustenance,
focused intent to return to the True,
unified spirit and clarity—
truly not easy,
years of effort alone suffice,
hence it is said,
"Cultivation requires enduring time."

Nourishment grants eternal renewal,
after taking the medicine,
the *Three Corpses* [三尸虫] gradually depart,
refined essence returns to the marrow,
complete restoration—
darkness becomes light,
youthful visage flourishes,
spirit sharpens and transcends,
Dao-*qi* brings auspiciousness,
the Five Sacred Peaks’ numinous truths
gather naturally,
soul and spirit pierce all,
the entire body like jade,
joining the playful ranks of the Immortals—
hence it is said,
"Nourishment grants eternal renewal."

Numbers in harmony bring transformation,
the Sage refines the spirit-medicine,
adjusting the numbers to govern the four seasons:
spring unfolds and all things grow,
summer thrives with blazing fire,
autumn gathers and gold ripens,
winter rests with water congealing.
Alchemists’ craft lies in attuning to these seasonal *qi* flows—
if one masters the four seasons’ breath,
the Golden Elixir naturally evolves,
hence it is said,
"Numbers in harmony bring transformation."

Numbers at their utmost become spirit,
speaking of the numbers’ completion.
Only when *yin-yang* numbers are fulfilled
does the elixir’s formula become divine.
*Yin* at its extreme yields hidden *yang*,
*Yang* at its extreme yields suppressed *yin*,
the two *qi* mutually interact,
the natural way of the Dao.
Again, the "extreme" refers to
the exhaustion of all possible transformations,
thus attaining the Dao of *yin-yang*—
the ultimate in numbers.
This is the subtlety of Immortals,
the law of transformation,
hence it is said,
"Numbers at their utmost become spirit."

Grasping this celestial mechanism,
the world’s accomplished deeds
are nothing more than attaining the Dao.
The Dao’s attainment is simple—
none surpasses the Elixir.
The Elixir’s refinement lies in controlling *qi*,
transforming *qi* into form,
none beyond the mastery of numbers.
Numbers forge the Golden Elixir,
*three-five* and *One* united—
grasping this celestial mechanism,
the affairs of Immortals are complete.
Eternally ranked among the True Persons.

The *jindan zhenyi lun* [True One Golden Elixir Scripture] is now concluded.
